zabad_1746.name: Zabad (Son of Shimeath)
zabad_1746.bio: The son of Shemath. He conspired against Joash, king of Judah, and slew him ([2 Chr. 24:25](/2chr#2Chr.24.25), [26](/2chr#2Chr.24.26)).

zabad_2946.name: Zabad (One of David's valiant men ( 1 Chronicle)

zabad_2947.name: Zabad (son of Ahlai)
zabad_2947.bio: One of David’s valiant men ([1 Chr. 11:41](/1chr#1Chr.11.41)), the descendant of Ahlai, of the “children of Sheshan” (2:31).

zabbai_2952.name: Zabbai (Baruch)
zabbai_2952.bio: The father of Baruch, who “earnestly repaired” part of the wall of Jerusalem ([Neh. 3:20](/neh#Neh.3.20); marg., “Zaccai”).

zabdi_2954.name: Zabdi (my gift)
zabdi_2954.bio: An ancestor of Achan ([Josh. 7:1](/josh#Josh.7.1), [17](/josh#Josh.7.17), [18](/josh#Josh.7.18)). He is probably the “Zimri” of [1 Chr.

zabdi_2956.name: Zabdi (son of Jehoiada)
zabdi_2956.bio: Called “the Shiphmite,” one of David’s officers, who had charge of his vineyards ([1 Chr. 27:27](/1chr#1Chr.27.27)).

zabdiel_2957.name: Zabdiel (Nathan the father of Zabad)
zabdiel_2957.bio: The father of Jashobeam, who was one of David’s officers ([1 Chr. 27:2](/1chr#1Chr.27.2)).

zabdiel_2958.name: Zabdiel (God has given)
zabdiel_2958.bio: An overseer of the priests after the Captivity ([Neh. 11:14](/neh#Neh.11.14)).

zabud_2959.name: Zabud
zabud_2959.bio: Gift, the son of Nathan, who was “king’s friend” in the court of Solomon ([1 Kings 4:5](/1kgs#1Kgs.4.5)).

zaccai_2960.name: Zaccai
zaccai_2960.bio: Pure, one whose “sons” returned with Zerubbabel to Jerusalem ([Ezra 2:9](/ezra#Ezra.2.9); [Neh. 7:14](/neh#Neh.7.14)).

zacchaeus_2961.name: Zacchaeus
zacchaeus_2961.bio: Pure, a superintendant of customs; a chief tax-gather (publicanus) at Jericho ([Luke 19:1-10](/luke#Luke.19.1)). “The collection of customs at Jericho, which at this time produced and exported a considerable quantity of balsam, was undoubtedly an important post, and would account for Zacchaeus being a rich man.” Being short of stature, he hastened on before the multitude who were thronging about Christ as he passed through Jericho on his way to Jerusalem, and climbed up a sycamore tree that he might be able to see him. When our Lord reached the spot he looked up to the publican among the branches, and addressing him by name, told him to make haste and come down, as he intended that day to abide at his house.

zaccur_2963.name: Zaccur (Reubenite)
zaccur_2963.bio: Father of Shammua, who was one of the spies sent out by Moses ([Num. 13:4](/num#Num.13.4)).

zaccur_2965.name: Zaccur (son of Asaph)
zaccur_2965.bio: A son of Asaph, and chief of one of the courses of singers as arranged by David ([1 Chr. 25:2](/1chr#1Chr.25.2), [10](/1chr#1Chr.25.10)).

zaccur_2967.name: Zaccur (He was sent to spy out)

zachariah_2969.name: Zachariah
zachariah_2969.bio: Son of Jeroboam II., king of Israel. On the death of his father there was an interregnum of ten years, at the end of which he succeeded to the throne, which he occupied only six months, having been put to death by Shallum, who usurped the throne. “He did that which was evil in the sight of the Lord, as his fathers had done” ([2 Kings 14:29](/2kgs#2Kgs.14.29); [15:8-12](/2kgs#2Kgs.15.8)).

zacharias_2971.name: Zacharias (A Jew in Israel)
zacharias_2971.bio: A priest of the course of Abia, the eighth of the twenty-four courses into which the priests had been originally divided by David ([1 Chr. 23:1-19](/1chr#1Chr.23.1)). Only four of these courses or “families” of the priests returned from the Exile ([Ezra 2:36-39](/ezra#Ezra.2.36)); but they were then re-distributed under the old designations.

zacharias_3011.name: Zacharias (son of Jehoiada)
zacharias_3011.bio: The son or grandson of Jehoiada, the high priest in the times of Ahaziah and Joash. After the death of Jehoiada he boldly condemned both the king and the people for their rebellion against God ([2 Chr. 24:20](/2chr#2Chr.24.20)), which so stirred up their resentment against him that at the king’s commandment they stoned him with stones, and he died “in the court of the house of the Lord” (24:21).

zacher_2972.name: Zacher
zacher_2972.bio: Memorial, a son of Jehiel ([1 Chr. 8:31](/1chr#1Chr.8.31); [9:35](/1chr#1Chr.9.35)); called Zechariah (9:37).

zadok_2973.name: Zadok (Appointed by Nehemiah)
zadok_2973.bio: A son of Ahitub, of the line of Eleazer ([2 Sam. 8:17](/2sam#2Sam.8.17); [1 Chr. 24:3](/1chr#1Chr.24.3)), high priest in the time of David ([2 Sam.

zadok_2974.name: Zadok (Jerusha daughter)
zadok_2974.bio: The father of Jerusha, who was wife of King Uzziah, and mother of King Jotham ([2 Kings 15:33](/2kgs#2Kgs.15.33); [2 Chr. 27:1](/2chr#2Chr.27.1)).

zadok_2976.name: Zadok (father of Jerusha)
zadok_2976.bio: The sons of Baana, one of those who assisted in rebuilding the wall of Jerusalem ([Neh. 3:4](/neh#Neh.3.4)).

zadok_2979.name: Zadok (Zakkur)
zadok_2979.bio: “The scribe” set over the treasuries of the temple by Nehemiah along with a priest and a Levite ([Neh. 13:13](/neh#Neh.13.13)).

zalmunna_2983.name: Zalmunna
zalmunna_2983.bio: One of the two kings of Midian whom the “Lord delivered” into the hands of Gideon. He was slain afterwards with Zebah ([Judg. 8:5-21](/judg#Judg.8.5)).

zattu_2986.name: Zattu
zattu_2986.bio: Id., one whose descendants returned from the Captivity with Zerubbabel ([Ezra 2:8](/ezra#Ezra.2.8); [Neh. 7:13](/neh#Neh.7.13)); probably the same as Zatthu.

zavan_2944.name: Zavan
zavan_2944.bio: Terror, one of the “dukes of Edom” ([Gen. 36:27](/gen#Gen.36.27)); called also Zavan ([1 Chr. 1:42](/1chr#1Chr.1.42)).

zaza_2987.name: Zaza
zaza_2987.bio: Plenty, a descendant of Judah ([1 Chr. 2:33](/1chr#1Chr.2.33)).

zebadiah_2991.name: Zebadiah (Meshelemiah had sons)
zebadiah_2991.bio: A Korhite porter of the Lord’s house ([1 Chr. 26:2](/1chr#1Chr.26.2)). Three or four others of this name are also mentioned.

zebadiah_2992.name: Zebadiah (Asahel the brother of Joab; his son Zeba)
zebadiah_2992.bio: A son of Asahel, Joab’s brother ([1 Chr. 27:7](/1chr#1Chr.27.7)).

zebadiah_2993.name: Zebadiah (The Levite)
zebadiah_2993.bio: A Levite who took part as one of the teachers in the system of national education instituted by Jehoshaphat ([2 Chr. 17:7](/2chr#2Chr.17.7), [8](/2chr#2Chr.17.8)).

zebadiah_2994.name: Zebadiah (A son of Asahel)
zebadiah_2994.bio: The son of Ishmael, “the ruler of the house of Judah in all the king’s matters” ([2 Chr. 19:8-11](/2chr#2Chr.19.8)).

zebah_2997.name: Zebah
zebah_2997.bio: Man-killer, or sacrifice, one of the two kings who led the vast host of the Midianites who invaded the land of Israel, and over whom Gideon gained a great and decisive victory ([Judg. 8](/judg#Judg.8)). Zebah and Zalmunna had succeeded in escaping across the Jordan with a remnant of the Midianite host, but were overtaken at Karkor, probably in the Hauran, and routed by Gideon.

zebedee_2998.name: Zebedee
zebedee_2998.bio: A Galilean fisherman, the husband of Salome (q.v.), and the father of James and John, two of our Lord’s disciples ([Matt. 4:21](/matt#Matt.4.21); [27:56](/matt#Matt.27.56); [Mark 15:40](/mark#Mark.15.40)). He seems to have been a man of some position in Capernaum, for he had two boats ([Luke 5:4](/luke#Luke.5.4)) and “hired servants” ([Mark 1:20](/mark#Mark.1.20)) of his own.

zebudah_3000.name: Zebudah
zebudah_3000.bio: Given, the wife of Josiah and mother of Jehoiakim ([2 Kings 23:36](/2kgs#2Kgs.23.36)).

zebul_3001.name: Zebul
zebul_3001.bio: Habitation, the governor of Shechem under Abimelech ([Judg. 9:28](/judg#Judg.9.28), [30](/judg#Judg.9.30), [36](/judg#Judg.9.36)). He informed his master of the intention of the people of Shechem to transfer their allegiance to the Hivite tribe of Hamor.

zebulun_3002.name: Zebulun
zebulun_3002.bio: Dwelling, the sixth and youngest son of Jacob and Leah ([Gen. 30:20](/gen#Gen.30.20)). Little is known of his personal history.

zechariah_2970.name: Zechariah (father of Abijah)
zechariah_2970.bio: The father of Abijah, who was the mother of Hezekiah ([2 Chr. 29:1](/2chr#2Chr.29.1)).

zechariah_3003.name: Zechariah (the priest)
zechariah_3003.bio: One of the chiefs of the tribe of Reuben ([1 Chr. 5:7](/1chr#1Chr.5.7)).

zechariah_3004.name: Zechariah (porter of the door of the tabernacle of)
zechariah_3004.bio: A Levite who assisted at the bringing up of the ark from the house of Obededom ([1 Chr. 15:20-24](/1chr#1Chr.15.20)).

zechariah_3006.name: Zechariah (The fourth son of Hosah and a Levite)

zechariah_3008.name: Zechariah (Remembered / Memory of the Lord)
zechariah_3008.bio: One who assisted in teaching the law to the people in the time of Jehoshaphat ([2 Chr. 17:7](/2chr#2Chr.17.7)).

zechariah_3009.name: Zechariah (Jahaziel)
zechariah_3009.bio: A Levite of the sons of Asaph ([2 Chr. 20:14](/2chr#2Chr.20.14)).

zechariah_3012.name: Zechariah (the prophet)
zechariah_3012.bio: A prophet, who had “understanding in the seeing of God,” in the time of Uzziah, who was much indebted to him for his wise counsel ([2 Chr. 26:5](/2chr#2Chr.26.5)). Besides these, there is a large number of persons mentioned in Scripture bearing this name of whom nothing is known.

zechariah_3015.name: Zechariah (Leader of God's House)
zechariah_3015.bio: One of the “rulers of the house of God” ([2 Chr. 35:8](/2chr#2Chr.35.8)).

zechariah_3016.name: Zechariah (son of Berechiah)
zechariah_3016.bio: A prophet of Judah, the eleventh of the twelve minor prophets. Like Ezekiel, he was of priestly extraction. He describes himself (1:1) as “the son of Berechiah.” In [Ezra 5:1](/ezra#Ezra.5.1) and 6:14 he is called “the son of Iddo,” who was properly his grandfather.

zechariah_3018.name: Zechariah (one of twenty eight descendants of Bebai)

zechariah_3028.name: Zechariah (Old Testament prophet who foretold in th)

zedekiah_1950.name: Zedekiah (who was made king)
zedekiah_1950.bio: The last king of Judah. He was the third son of Josiah, and his mother’s name was Hamutal, the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah, and hence he was the brother of Jehoahaz ([2 Kings 23:31](/2kgs#2Kgs.23.31); [24:17](/2kgs#2Kgs.24.17), [18](/2kgs#2Kgs.24.18)). His original name was Mattaniah; but when Nebuchadnezzar placed him on the throne as the successor to Jehoiachin he changed his name to Zedekiah.

zedekiah_3029.name: Zedekiah (son of Kenaanah)
zedekiah_3029.bio: The son of Chenaanah, a false prophet in the days of Ahab ([1 Kings 22:11](/1kgs#1Kgs.22.11), [24](/1kgs#1Kgs.22.24); [2 Chr. 18:10](/2chr#2Chr.18.10), [23](/2chr#2Chr.18.23)).

zedekiah_3032.name: Zedekiah (son of Hananiah)
zedekiah_3032.bio: The son of Hananiah, a prince of Judah in the days of Jehoiakim ([Jer. 36:12](/jer#Jer.36.12)).

zeeb_3033.name: Zeeb
zeeb_3033.bio: The wolf, one of the two leaders of the great Midianite host which invaded Israel and was utterly routed by Gideon. The division of that host, which attempted to escape across the Jordan, under Oreb and Zeeb, was overtaken by the Ephraimites, who, in a great battle, completely vanquished them, their leaders being taken and slain ([Judg. 7:25](/judg#Judg.7.25); [Ps.

zelek_3034.name: Zelek
zelek_3034.bio: Cleft, an Ammonite; one of David’s valiant men ([2 Sam. 23:37](/2sam#2Sam.23.37)).

zelophehad_3035.name: Zelophehad
zelophehad_3035.bio: First-born, of the tribe of Manasseh, and of the family of Gilead; died in the wilderness. Having left no sons, his daughters, concerned lest their father’s name should be “done away from among his family,” made an appeal to Moses, who, by divine direction, appointed it as “a statute of judgment” in Israel that daughters should inherit their father’s portion when no sons were left ([Num. 27:1-11](/num#Num.27.1)).

zemarite_3036.name: Zemarite
zemarite_3036.bio: The designation of one of the Phoenician tribes ([Gen. 10:18](/gen#Gen.10.18)) who inhabited the town of Sumra, at the western base of the Lebanon range. In the Amarna tablets (B.C.

zemira_3037.name: Zemira
zemira_3037.bio: Vine-dresser, a Benjamite; one of the sons of Becher ([1 Chr. 7:8](/1chr#1Chr.7.8)).

zenas_3038.name: Zenas
zenas_3038.bio: A disciple called “the lawyer,” whom Paul wished Titus to bring with him ([Titus 3:13](/titus#Titus.3.13)). Nothing more is known of him.

zephaniah_3039.name: Zephaniah (son of Maaseiah the priest)
zephaniah_3039.bio: The son of Maaseiah, the “second priest” in the reign of Zedekiah, often mentioned in Jeremiah as having been sent from the king to inquire ([Jer. 21:1](/jer#Jer.21.1)) regarding the coming woes which he had denounced, and to entreat the prophet’s intercession that the judgment threatened might be averted ([Jer. 29:25](/jer#Jer.29.25), [26](/jer#Jer.29.26), [29](/jer#Jer.29.29); 37:3; 52:24).

zephaniah_3041.name: Zephaniah (father of Josiah)
zephaniah_3041.bio: The father of Josiah, the priest who dwelt in Jerusalem when Darius issued the decree that the temple should be rebuilt ([Zech. 6:10](/zech#Zech.6.10)).

zerah_2984.name: Zerah (sons of Judah)
zerah_2984.bio: A son of Tamar ([Gen. 38:30](/gen#Gen.38.30)); called also Zara ([Matt. 1:3](/matt#Matt.1.3)).

zerah_3046.name: Zerah (chariots)
zerah_3046.bio: An “Ethiopian,” probably Osorkon II., the successor of Shishak on the throne of Egypt. With an enormous army, the largest we read of in Scripture, he invaded the kingdom of Judah in the days of Asa ([2 Chr. 14:9-15](/2chr#2Chr.14.9)).

zerah_3102.name: Zerah (A son of Tamar ( Genesis 38:30)
zerah_3102.bio: One of the sons of Simeon ([Gen. 46:10](/gen#Gen.46.10); [Ex. 6:15](/exod#Exod.6.15)).

zeresh_3049.name: Zeresh
zeresh_3049.bio: Star of Venus, the wife of Haman, whom she instigated to prepare a gallows for Mordecai ([Esther 5:10](/esth#Esth.5.10)).

zeruah_3053.name: Zeruah
zeruah_3053.bio: Stricken, mother of Jeroboam, the first king of the ten tribes ([1 Kings 11:26](/1kgs#1Kgs.11.26)).

zerubbabel_3054.name: Zerubbabel
zerubbabel_3054.bio: The seed of Babylon, the son of Salathiel or Shealtiel ([Hag. 1:1](/hag#Hag.1.1); Zorobabel, [Matt. 1:12](/matt#Matt.1.12)); called also the son of Pedaiah ([1 Chr.

zeruiah_3055.name: Zeruiah
zeruiah_3055.bio: Stricken of the Lord, David’s sister, and the mother of Abishai, Joab, and Asahel ([1 Chr. 2:16](/1chr#1Chr.2.16)), who were the three leading heroes of David’s army, and being his nephews, they were admitted to the closest companionship with him.

ziba_3060.name: Ziba
ziba_3060.bio: Post; statue, “a servant of the house of Saul” ([2 Sam. 9:2](/2sam#2Sam.9.2)), who informed David that Mephibosheth, a son of Jonathan, was alive. He afterwards dealt treacherously toward Mephibosheth, whom he slanderously misrepresented to David.

zibeon_3062.name: Zibeon (A Horite chief. Ancestor of Oholibamah)

zibiah_3064.name: Zibiah
zibiah_3064.bio: The mother of King Joash ([2 Kings 12:1](/2kgs#2Kgs.12.1); [2 Chr. 24:1](/2chr#2Chr.24.1)).

zichri_3067.name: Zichri (son of Shashak)
zichri_3067.bio: Another of the same tribe ([1 Chr. 8:23](/1chr#1Chr.8.23)).

zichri_3069.name: Zichri (1 Chronicles 8:19)
zichri_3069.bio: A Levite, one of the sons of Asaph ([Neh. 11:17](/neh#Neh.11.17)); probably the same as Zichri ([1 Chr. 9:15](/1chr#1Chr.9.15)), and Zaccur ([Neh.

zidkijah_3077.name: Zidkijah
zidkijah_3077.bio: The Lord is righteous, one who sealed the covenant with Nehemiah ([Neh. 10:1](/neh#Neh.10.1)).

zidon_2738.name: Zidon
zidon_2738.bio: A fishery, a town on the Mediterranean coast, about 25 miles north of Tyre. It received its name from the “first-born” of Canaan, the grandson of Noah ([Gen. 10:15](/gen#Gen.10.15), [19](/gen#Gen.10.19)).

ziha_3078.name: Ziha (Hasupha)
ziha_3078.bio: The name of a family of Nethinim ([Ezra 2:43](/ezra#Ezra.2.43); [Neh. 7:46](/neh#Neh.7.46)).

zillah_3080.name: Zillah
zillah_3080.bio: Shadow, one of the wives of Lamech, of the line of Cain, and mother of Tubal-cain ([Gen. 4:19](/gen#Gen.4.19), [22](/gen#Gen.4.22)).

zilpah_3081.name: Zilpah
zilpah_3081.bio: Drooping, Leah’s handmaid, and the mother of Gad and Asher ([Gen. 30:9-13](/gen#Gen.30.9)).

zilthai_3082.name: Zilthai (One of the captains of the tribe of Mana)

zilthai_3083.name: Zilthai (one of the soldiers from Manasseh who we)
zilthai_3083.bio: One of the captains of the tribe of Manasseh who joined David at Ziklag ([1 Chr. 12:20](/1chr#1Chr.12.20)).

zimran_3086.name: Zimran
zimran_3086.bio: Vine-dressers; celebrated, one of the sons of Abraham by Keturah ([Gen. 25:2](/gen#Gen.25.2)).

zimri_3087.name: Zimri (he was the only king in Israel that reig)

zimri_3088.name: Zimri (king of Israel)
zimri_3088.bio: Murdered Elah at Tirzah, and succeeded him on the throne of Israel ([1 Kings 16:8-10](/1kgs#1Kgs.16.8)). He reigned only seven days, for Omri, whom the army elected as king, laid siege to Tirzah, whereupon Zimri set fire to the palace and perished amid its ruins (11-20). Omri succeeded to the throne only after four years of fierce war with Tibni, another claimant to the throne.

zippor_3094.name: Zippor
zippor_3094.bio: A little bird, the father of Balak, king of Moab ([Num. 22:2](/num#Num.22.2), [4](/num#Num.22.4)).

zipporah_3095.name: Zipporah
zipporah_3095.bio: A female bird. Reuel’s daughter, who became the wife of Moses ([Ex. 2:21](/exod#Exod.2.21)).

zithri_3096.name: Zithri
zithri_3096.bio: The Lord protects, a Levite, son of Uzziel ([Ex. 6:22](/exod#Exod.6.22)).

zohar_3101.name: Zohar
zohar_3101.bio: The father of Ephron the Hittite ([Gen. 23:8](/gen#Gen.23.8)).

zoheth_3103.name: Zoheth
zoheth_3103.bio: Snatching (?), one of the sons of Ishi ([1 Chr. 4:20](/1chr#1Chr.4.20)).

zophah_3104.name: Zophah
zophah_3104.bio: Spreading out, a son of Helem ([1 Chr. 7:35](/1chr#1Chr.7.35)), a chief of Asher.

zophar_3105.name: Zophar
zophar_3105.bio: Chirping, one of Job’s friends who came to condole with him in his distress ([Job 2:11](/job#Job.2.11). The LXX. render here “king of the Mineans” = Ma’in, Maonites, [Judg.

zuph_3108.name: Zuph
zuph_3108.bio: Honeycomb, a Kohathite Levite, ancestor of Elkanah and Samuel ([1 Sam. 1:1](/1sam#1Sam.1.1)); called also Zophai ([1 Chr. 6:26](/1chr#1Chr.6.26)).

zur_3110.name: Zur (one of the Midianite Chiefs defeated by)
zur_3110.bio: One of the five Midianite kings whom the Israelites defeated and put to death ([Num. 31:8](/num#Num.31.8)).

zuriel_3112.name: Zuriel
zuriel_3112.bio: Rock of God, chief of the family of the Merarites ([Num. 3:35](/num#Num.3.35)) at the time of the Exodus.

zurishaddai_3113.name: Zurishaddai
zurishaddai_3113.bio: Rock of the Almighty, the father of Shelumiel, who was chief of the tribe of Simeon when Israel was encamped at Sinai ([Num. 1:6](/num#Num.1.6); [2:12](/num#Num.2.12)).
